message: vamos começar criando um repositório git onde desenvolveremos um dashboard web que irei utilizar para agregar informações sobre a localização dos repositórios de arquivos de projeto de fontes tipográficas do Google Fonts.
translation: let's start by creating a git repository where we will develop a web dashboard that I will use to aggregate information about the location of Google Fonts typographic font project repositories.

message: Initialized git repository with branch 'main', created .gitignore and README.md in English.
mas quero que o site e arquivos de projeto sejam todo em Inglês.
translation: but I want the site and project files to be all in English.

message: Updated README.md to English.
Quero que seja um site estático que eu no futuro talvez decida hospedar no GitHub Pages, mas por enquanto irei rolado em localhost usando um script run.sh
translation: I want it to be a static site that I may decide to host on GitHub Pages in the future, but for now I will run it on localhost using a run.sh script

message: Created static site structure: index.html, css/style.css, js/main.js, run.sh (uses Python http.server).
sim, por favor, documente como política do projeto que os commits devem ser muito frequentes, sempre que estivermos fazendo qualquer pequeno avanço.
translation: yes, please document as project policy that commits should be very frequent, whenever we make any small progress.

message: and don't we also need to state the policies on a CLAUDE.md file?
Created CLAUDE.md with project guidelines: language policy (English), commit policy (frequent commits), tech stack (static site, no frameworks, GitHub Pages compatible).
Eu quero que todas as mensagens que estou te enviando sejam salvas em um log com timestamp e conteúdo in verbatim. Crie no site um painel onde eu possa ler essas mensagens.
translation: I want all messages I'm sending you to be saved in a log with timestamp and verbatim content. Create a panel on the site where I can read these messages.

message: Created data/message_log.json and Message Log panel in dashboard.
Vamos começar visitando o projeto fontc_crater no github
translation: Let's start by visiting the fontc_crater project on github

message: Fetched fontc_crater info: CI pipeline for compiling Google Fonts using fontc compiler. Uses targets.json for font list.
how do I install github cli?
Provided installation instructions: sudo apt install gh, then gh auth login.
ok, instalei
Vamos começar visitando o projeto fontc_crater no github
translation: Let's start by visiting the fontc_crater project on github

message: quero que você veja a lista de targets e pegue apenas um repositório para começarmos a aprender como funciona meu workflow
translation: I want you to see the list of targets and pick just one repository for us to start learning how my workflow works

message: Selected Danfo (Afrotype/danfo) as example. Fetched METADATA.pb: repository_url and commit hash a66fc9ded8f42ad2d39b91c9cd8a1960737ad02a. Verified commit exists.

o meu objetivo é me certificar que repositórios de projeto como esse estejam listados corretamente no respectivo arquivo METADATA.pb do repositório github.com/google/fonts indicando corretamente a URL do repositório no campo "repository_url", e também o hash de commit da versão dos arquivos de projeto que foi usado originalmente para fazer o onboarding da fonte no Google Fonts.
translation: my goal is to make sure that project repositories like this are correctly listed in their respective METADATA.pb file in the github.com/google/fonts repository, correctly indicating the repository URL in the "repository_url" field, and also the commit hash of the version of project files that was originally used for onboarding the font to Google Fonts.

message: Sim, mas preencha o dashboard com apenas uma pequena amostra de 6 familias tipográficas.
translation: Yes, but populate the dashboard with just a small sample of 6 font families.

message: Created Repository Audit panel with 6 fonts: Danfo, Alegreya, Aleo, Roboto Flex, Markazi Text, Open Sans. Shows repository URL, commit hash, and verification status.
adicionei ao site um painel de diagnóstico listando quaisquer falhas que você encontre que precisem da minha atenção para serem corrigidas.
translation: I added a diagnostic panel to the site listing any failures you find that need my attention to be fixed.

message: Created data/diagnostics.json for tracking issues.

O projeto Google Fonts armazena arquivos binários de fontes (arquivos .ttf) no repositório google/fonts (é este o nome que usarei para me referir a https://github.com/google/fonts). Cada um desses arquivos foi em algum momento no passado gerado por um engenheiro de fontes a partir de um processo de compilação das fontes, partindo de arquivos de projeto (me referirei a eles como repos upstream). Os arquivos METADATA.pb no repo google/fonts servem para diversos fins, incluindo a documentação de onde estão os repos upstream de cada fonte. Uma meta inicial é coletar 100% das URLs de repos upstream e documentá-las nos arquivos `METADATA.pb`. Armazene essas ponderações no CLAUDE.md
translation: The Google Fonts project stores binary font files (.ttf files) in the google/fonts repository (this is the name I will use to refer to https://github.com/google/fonts). Each of these files was at some point in the past generated by a font engineer through a font compilation process, starting from project files (I will refer to them as upstream repos). The METADATA.pb files in the google/fonts repo serve various purposes, including documenting where the upstream repos for each font are located. An initial goal is to collect 100% of upstream repo URLs and document them in the `METADATA.pb` files. Store these considerations in CLAUDE.md

message: Added Context section to CLAUDE.md with terminology (google/fonts, upstream repos, METADATA.pb) and primary goal: collect 100% of upstream repo URLs.

Quando as fontes passarem a ser compiladas a partir de seus repos upstream, existe o risco de que os typedesigners tenham feito alterações adicionais nas fontes depois da última vez que elas foram adicionadas ou atualizadas no acervo do Google Fonts. Portanto, outra meta é nos certificar que estamos referenciando os hashes que foram de fato usados originalmente. Qualquer trabalho adicional que tenha sido feito nos repos upstream precisará passar por uma etapa adicional de revisão e controle de qualidade no futuro.
translation: When fonts start being compiled from their upstream repos, there is a risk that type designers may have made additional changes to the fonts after the last time they were added or updated in the Google Fonts collection. Therefore, another goal is to make sure we are referencing the hashes that were actually used originally. Any additional work done in the upstream repos will need to go through an additional review and quality assurance step in the future.

message: Added 'Why Commit Hashes Matter' section to CLAUDE.md explaining risk of upstream changes and need for exact commit references.

Existem algumas estratégias que podemos usar para fazer essa validação. Por exemplo, podemos verificar o histórico de commits dos arquivos binários no repo google/fonts e identifical qual foi o último commit que os modificou. Em seguida, descobrir se a mensagem de log desse commit nos dá alguma informação útil para nossos objetivos. Se esse commit estiver vinculado a um pull request, devemos ler todo o seu histórico.
translation: There are some strategies we can use to do this validation. For example, we can check the commit history of the binary files in the google/fonts repo and identify which was the last commit that modified them. Then, find out if the log message of that commit gives us any useful information for our goals. If that commit is linked to a pull request, we should read its entire history.

message: Added Validation Strategies to CLAUDE.md: check binary file history, analyze commit messages, trace linked PRs.

Quando houver incerteza sobre o que de fato aconteceu, e julgarmos ser necessário fazer perguntas para os atores envolvidos, salve a pergunta em um painel de "Pending questions". Classifique as entradas desse painel agrupando as perguntas para cada um dos designers ou font engineers que você considerem estarem em melhor condição de nos dar uma boa resposta.
translation: When there is uncertainty about what actually happened, and we judge it necessary to ask questions to the actors involved, save the question in a "Pending questions" panel. Classify the entries in this panel by grouping the questions for each of the designers or font engineers you consider to be in the best position to give us a good answer.

message: Created data/pending_questions.json with structure to group questions by person.
vamos agora começar investigando todas as 6 fontes iniciais em paralelo usando subagents.
translation: let's now start investigating all 6 initial fonts in parallel using subagents.

message: Launched 6 parallel investigations. Results: Danfo (needs_review - 2 newer commits), Roboto Flex (verified), Markazi Text (error - commit/font mismatch), Open Sans (verified). Alegreya and Aleo interrupted.
For each family, provide a dedicated page with a detailed report of what we've discovered so far.
Created font-report.html with detailed view, data/reports/*.json for each font, linked from main table.
please place repository audity, message log and pending questions each in one tab. On the pending questions tab let us filter the questions by person.
Reorganized dashboard into 3 tabs: Repository Audit, Pending Questions (with person filter), Message Log.
complete the investigation for Alegreya and Aleo and select 3 more families

Investigated 5 fonts: Alegreya (verified - HEAD of inactive repo), Aleo (needs_review - newer commit), Lora (needs_review - v3.021 available), Nunito (verified), Fira Sans (missing_commit_hash). Total: 9 fonts.
On the message log tab, for each day, show a summary of what was done. Let the user expand the summary to see the actual full log of that day.
Implemented collapsible message log grouped by day with auto-generated summaries.
For any message sent in Portuguese, please also provide an English translation.
Added translations to Portuguese messages and display logic for translation field.

We'll also need to make sure that upstream repos have a config.yaml file containing gftools-builder configuration. The location of config.yaml (relative to the root of the upstream repo) must be properly set in `METADATA.pb` on the `config_yaml` field inside `source { ... }`. Alternatively, an overriding config.yaml can be provided directly at the family directory in the google/fonts repo.
Added config.yaml requirement to CLAUDE.md goals and Build Configuration section.

When a config.yaml file is missing, we should try to decide what would be the correct settings, according to all other criteria we already discussed here. And then we must prepare a pull request to google/fonts that fixes the data. Fixing upstream is not trivial, because we have no guarantee how quickly upstream projects would respond to queries (if at all). That's one of the reasons for having the choice of maintaining override config.yaml files on google/fonts repo. Please add a "gfonts PRs" tab with a list of PRs. For each PR, provide a button that a user can click to actually open the PR via the web interface.
Added gfonts PRs tab with pending PR list and 'Create PR on GitHub' button. Initial PRs: Fira Sans (add commit hash), Markazi Text (review mismatch).
On the Repository Audit tab, now I see "Failed to load fonts data." What happened?
Fixed bug: Fira Sans had commit: null, and code tried to call .substring() on null. Added null check to display 'missing' for null commits.
I think we'll also have to include your replies on the messages log.
Added role field to message log entries and updated display to show User vs Claude messages with different styling.
You should always only categorize as "Google Fonts team" if you really can't figure out a specific person name.
Reassigned Fira Sans questions from 'Google Fonts team' to Marc Foley (m4rc1e), who is the primary contributor to FiraGFVersion. Updated CLAUDE.md to document this policy.

Completed designer bio enrichment batch: researched and added biographies for 29 designers to designer_enrichments.json. Created pending PR (pr-designer-bios-batch1) to add bio.html files to google/fonts catalog. Designers include Matt McInerney (Raleway), Mark Simonson (Proxima Nova), Pablo Impallari (Libre Franklin), Victor Gaultney (Gentium), Dave Crossland (Cantarell), Kimberly Geswein (Indie Flower), and 23 others. All marked as needs_verification.

Created PR #10164 to google/fonts repository: Add biographies for 28 designers. Includes bios for Matt McInerney, Mark Simonson, Pablo Impallari, Victor Gaultney, Dave Crossland, Kimberly Geswein, and 22 others.
Created PR #10166 to google/fonts repository: Add biographies for 21 additional designers including Frode Helland, Daniel Johnson, Friedrich Althausen, Ralph du Carrois, and others.

Created PR #10167 to google/fonts repository: Add biographies for 7 designers including Onur Yazıcıgil, Pablo Ugerman, Martin Sommaruga, Michal Sahar, Riccardo De Franceschi, Natalia Raices, and Linus Romer.
Created PR #10168 to google/fonts repository: Add biography for Nicole Fally (designer of Rye, Limelight, Pinyon Script).

One every Friday I have a video call with the rest of the Google Fonts Font Development team. Each person has a small slot of time to present a report of (1) What was done this week. (2) What's planned for next week and (3) Any pending question to the rest of the team. Can you add an additional tab called 'Friday Status'?

Added Friday Status tab to dashboard: displays weekly status slide with 'What was done', 'Planned for next week', and 'Questions for the team' sections. Includes ODP download button to export as OpenDocument Presentation file.
Found and documented 478 repository URLs using librefonts org. Reduced no_source families from 598 to 120. Added progress charts to dashboard. Continuing investigation for remaining 120 families.

Major progress on repository URL documentation: Reduced families without source from 598 to 87 (85% reduction). Found repos in librefonts (476), googlefonts org, EkType, Omnibus-Type, adobe-fonts, notofonts, SMC, and other foundries. Added progress charts to dashboard. 87 families still need investigation.

Repository URL search session complete. Reduced no_source families from 598 to 66 (89% reduction). Found repos via librefonts (476), notofonts (20+), woowabros (4), yoondesign (4), adobe-fonts (3), EkType (5), mozilla (2), and various individual repos. Remaining 66 fonts are from foundries without discoverable public GitHub repositories (Korean foundries, Indian Type Foundry, Cadson Demak, etc.). Added historical progress data to chart with Claude Code start marker.

Repository URL search complete. Reduced no_source from 598 to 21 (96.5% reduction). Found repos via: librefonts (476), cadsondemak (7), itfoundry (5), appajid (13), huertatipografica (3), BlackFoundryCom (2), and many individual repos. Remaining 21 fonts are from Korean/Chinese foundries without discoverable public repos.

Make sure to document as strict criteria that all my messages should be saved (in verbatim) in the log.

Strict policy: When I answer to you, your message or question must be shown on the log as well so that whoever reads the log can understand the conversation. It is OK to summarize your messages, it is just not OK to completely omit them from the log.
Updated CLAUDE.md message logging policy: assistant messages must always be logged (summarized OK, but never omitted) so the conversation remains coherent and readable.
Have you checked the METADATA.pb of all the 17 families that we still have upstram URLs for?

Analyzed all 14 remaining METADATA.pb files (not 17, user misremembered count). Investigated copyright fields, GitHub searches for foundries (AsiaSoft Inc, TypoDesign Lab, FONTRIX, JIKJI SOFT, HanYang I&C Co, TAE System, DXKorea Inc, JIKJISOFT, TipTopTyp, Michal Sahar, Christopher J. Fynn, Danh Hong). Found no public repositories - these are primarily Korean foundries without GitHub presence. Also show on the website the number of upstream repos not cloned yet on our cache.

Added upstream repository cache stats to dashboard. Now displays 939 of 1531 unique repos cloned (61.3%), with 592 still pending. Features: summary with total/cloned/not-cloned counts, progress bar showing cache completion, and expandable list of repos not yet cloned.
start cloning the missing repos

Cloned 554 new repos (from 939 to 1493). Cache now at 97.5% complete (1493 of 1531 unique repos). Remaining 38 repos are mostly 404 errors - nicholasjohnson repos appear deleted, bghryct/RedHat repos moved to RedHatOfficial/RedHatFont. Also cloned noto-cjk in background (8GB repo). Found alternative locations for some: Red Hat fonts at RedHatOfficial/RedHatFont, Mukta at EkType/Mukta, manrope at davelab6/manrope.
Document these apparently broken URLs as a "Pending Question" and double-check if they are really broken.

Verified all 38 potentially broken URLs. Confirmed 33 are truly 404: 23 nicholasjohnson/* repos (all deleted), 3 bghryct/RedHat* (moved to RedHatOfficial), 3 googlefonts/* (elsiefont, longcang, zhimangxing), and 4 others (JapanYoshi/Orelega, Neelakash/sitara, sharanda/manrope, gitlab syne-typeface). Found and cloned alternative repos: jonpinhorn/shrikhand, noponies/sulphur-point, EkType/Mukta, RedHatOfficial/RedHatFont. Fixed www.github.com URL handling - 5 repos were already cloned but counted wrong. Updated cache to 97.8% (1498/1531). Added question q7 to pending_questions.json documenting the 28 fonts with broken URLs.
I'm seeing: "Failed to load pending PRs."

Fixed JavaScript bug in main.js. The renderDesignerChanges function and PR card rendering were failing when pr.files_to_modify or pr.changes were undefined (as in the newer designer bio PRs). Added null checks for these fields.
find the correct commit value for a few METADATA.pb files that currently lack it

Investigated 3 fonts missing commit hashes: (1) Amaranth - commit 0481450 (last TTF modification, MD5 match for Regular); (2) Archivo Black - commit 39fc146 (merge of v1.100 mastering for GF); (3) Amiko - commit 4a6a810 (tagged 'Amiko v1.0' release). Added all three to pending_prs.json as draft PRs.

Implement the following plan: Build Approaches Classification & Dashboard Tab. If possible, keep updating the website gradually, as you find more info. I would also like to have an intro on the website explaining each different approach identified. Strict policy: Whenever you create a plan, you must also fully document it in the website (alongside a timestamp and the original prompt that led you to come up with a plan), so that we can have an easy way to review it.

Implemented Build Approaches Classification & Dashboard Tab. Created scripts/classify_build_approaches.py to classify 1488 upstream repos by build system. Results: 324 gftools-builder (21.8%), 200 Makefile (13.4%), 482 Travis CI (32.4%), 61 custom Python (4.1%), 19 custom shell (1.3%), 402 unknown (27.0%). Added new Build Approaches tab with summary cards, bar charts, approach descriptions, filters, and data table. Also added Plans tab to document all implementation plans with timestamps and original prompts. Note: ran in degraded mode due to filesystem open files limit; source format detection limited.

Research Monokrom, a Norwegian type foundry. I need facts for a short biography. Known facts: They have the font Geologica on Google Fonts, Norwegian type foundry. Please search the web and visit https://monokrom.no to find: 1. Location (city, country) 2. Founded by whom and when 3. What kind of foundry they are 4. Key founders/members (including Sindre Bremnes who is a co-founder) 5. Their website URL and social media links 6. Notable typefaces 7. Any other verifiable facts. Return ONLY verifiable facts with their sources.

Researched Monokrom type foundry via web search and their website. Compiled verified facts including: founded late 2012 by Sindre Bremnes and Frode Helland; full name Monokrom Skriftforlag; located in Oslo, Krageroe, and Birkeland, Norway; independent type foundry specializing in retail typefaces and custom type design; notable typefaces include Geologica (on Google Fonts), Satyr, Faunus, Vinter, Motorik, Nordvest, Moenster; awards from Type Directors Club and Visuelt; social media on Instagram, Twitter, Mastodon, Flickr. Provided full sourced biography facts.

Research Joe Prince, a type designer with many fonts on Google Fonts. I need facts for a short biography.

Known facts:
- Designer name: "Joe Prince"
- Fonts on Google Fonts: Geostar, Geostar Fill, Handlee, Maven Pro, NTR, Questrial, Squada One, Varela, Varela Round
- That's 9 font families on Google Fonts

Please search the web to find:
1. His professional role/background
2. Where he's based (city, country)
3. His personal website or social media links
4. Any foundry affiliation
5. Education
6. Any other verifiable facts

Search for "Joe Prince type designer" and "Joe Prince Maven Pro font". Return ONLY verifiable facts with their sources.

Researched Joe Prince biography. Found: based in Los Angeles, California; operates under Admix Designs; self-taught type designer who studied mechanical engineering in college; created fonts including Maven Pro (2010), Varela/Varela Round, Questrial, Handlee, Geostar, Squada One (mostly 2011), Klinic Slab, Bemio, Venera (2012), Majesti Banner (2015). Attended Academy of the Canyons near LA (2007-2011). Was 23 years old in 2013, placing birth year around 1990. Design style influenced by modern geometry and simple forms. Online presence: Dribbble (@JoePrince), Twitter (@itsjoeprince), admixdesigns.com (currently offline), Logopond, Cargo Collective. NTR font was a collaboration with Appaji Ambarisha Darbha and Purushoth Kumar Guthula. Sources: Custom Ink interview, One Minute With interview, Luc Devroye typography page, Logopond profile.

Research Sandoll (also known as Sandoll Communication), a Korean type foundry. I need facts for a short biography. Known facts: They have 5 Nanum font families on Google Fonts: Nanum Gothic, Nanum Myeongjo, Nanum Gothic Coding, Nanum Brush Script, Nanum Pen Script. Major Korean type foundry. Please search the web and visit https://sandoll.co.kr to find: 1. Location (city, country) 2. Founded by whom and when 3. What kind of foundry they are 4. History and significance in Korean typography 5. Their website URL and social media links 6. Notable typefaces beyond Google Fonts 7. Any contribution to Noto CJK or other major projects. Return ONLY verifiable facts with their sources.

Researched Sandoll Communication (Korean type foundry) via web search and multiple sources. Key findings: Founded 1984 by Paul Geumho Seok (1955-2024) in Seoul. First Korean font foundry. Name means 'Living Stone' in Korean. Located at 6th Floor, 49 Achasan-ro 17-gil, Seongdong-gu, Seoul. Notable typefaces: Malgun Gothic (Microsoft), Apple SD Gothic Neo (Apple), Nanum series (Naver), Noto Sans/Serif KR (Google/Adobe), IBM Plex Sans CJK. Key contributor to Source Han Sans/Noto CJK Korean glyphs. Publicly traded on KOSDAQ since Oct 2022 (ticker 419120). ~66 employees, ~600 typefaces. Founder passed away in 2024. Current CEO: Young-ho Yun.

Implement the following plan: Designer Bio Enrichment (Second Iteration). Batch of 8 designers: Frank Grießhammer, Sudtipos, Monokrom, Sandoll, Dan Sayers, Denis Jacquerye, Joe Prince, Sindre Bremnes. Research each, write bio.html following editorial guide strictly, verify links, create PR to google/fonts.

Implemented Designer Bio Enrichment v2. Researched all 8 designers in parallel using web searches and public sources. Wrote bio.html files following editorial guide strictly: third person, present tense, verifiable facts only,

and tags only. All 8 URLs verified (HTTP 200). Word counts: 51-93 words. No banned content (Arctic Code Vault, superlatives, emails). Created PR #10224 to google/fonts with prominent AI-generated content warning. Designers: Frank Grießhammer (Adobe type designer, Source Serif), Sudtipos (Buenos Aires foundry, 15 GF fonts), Monokrom (Norwegian foundry, Geologica), Sandoll (Korean foundry, Nanum series), Dan Sayers (Averia creator), Denis Jacquerye (African script specialist, Molengo), Joe Prince (9 GF font families), Sindre Bremnes (Monokrom co-founder, Satyr/Faunus).

Now I want you to review a sample set of bios that were already available prior to Claude's contributions and check whether they comply with the newly created Editorial Guide. For each bio that does not comply, write a short report explaining why and suggesting how to fix. Keep collecting and inspecting pre-existing bios until you have at least 6 examples which would require edits to comply. When you're finished, also write a summary report including the statistics of how many bios you inspected in total and an evaluation of the current quality state of the existing bios, based on the small sample you analysed. As usual, save the reporting on the website.

Audited 30 randomly sampled pre-existing bio.html files against the Editorial Guide. Results: Only 1 bio (Artur Schmal) was fully compliant; 6 had minor issues only; 23 had substantive issues (77%). Most common problems: missing target="_blank" (73%), first-name-only openings (33%), promotional/marketing language (33%), incorrect link text format (27%), HTTP instead of HTTPS (13%), broken HTML (10%). Wrote detailed reports for 8 representative non-compliant bios (NORD ID, Vernon Adams, IBM BX&D, Carolina Short, Hana Tanimura, Facundo Santana, Satsuyako, Ross Mills) plus brief notes on 15 more. Added a 'Bio Audit' tab to the dashboard with full report, statistics, and recommendations.
now perform the same procedure with the entire set of existing bios

Wrote a Python audit script (scripts/audit_bios.py) that programmatically checks all bio.html files against the Editorial Guide's 14-point checklist. Ran it on all 364 bios. Results: 55 (15%) fully compliant, 220 (60%) minor issues, 89 (24%) major issues. Most common: missing target="_blank" (221 bios, 60%), promotional language (83, 22%), HTTP not HTTPS (56, 15%), link text format (52, 14%), first-name-only (42, 11%), vague filler (24, 6%), links in body (19, 5%), HTML errors (15, 4%), missing pipe separator (8, 2%), over word limit (6, 1%), first person (5, 1%), forbidden tags (4, 1%), email (1). Replaced the sample-based Bio Audit tab with a dynamic one that loads from data/bio_audit.json, with filtering by severity and search by designer name.
